text:
Sixth Avenue, at the S.W. corner of Downing Street, showing the former site of the church of Our Lady of Pompeii. This is included in the new 6th Avenue extension. The new church is one block above, at Bleecker and Carmine Streets.

The photographer gives his vantage point as Hancock Street, a former one block street. This is also included in the new roadway and its identity lost.

Downing Street runs across the view. The 2 1/2 story structures shown are on same.

October 11, 1928
Views 1,2

P.L. Sperr

Sixth Avenue, at the S.W. corner of Downing Street, showing the former site of the church of Our Lady of Pompeii. This is included in the new 6th Avenue extension. The new church is one block above, at Bleecker and Carmine Streets.

The photographer gives his vantage point as Hancock Street, a former one block street. This is also included in the new roadway and its identity lost.

Downing Street runs across the view. The 2 1/2 story structures shown are on same.

October 11, 1928
Views 1,2

P.L. Sperr

Sixth Ave. (Extension), west side, at Downing Street. The old, 2 1/2-story gabled house, (on the extreme left, the side of which is covered by the Sunkist advertisement), is No. 12 Downing Street. Also seen, is the N.W. corner of Downing, which is now a children's playground; built by the W.P.A. At the extreme right, are seen the rears of buildings facing on the south side of Carmine Street.

October 29, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

Sixth Avenue, west side, at Downing Street, showing a panoramic arrangement that individually depicts the S. W. and N. W. corners. To the right is Bleecker Street. Upon same, at Carmine Street, appears the new Church of Our Lady of Pompeii. This organization was formerly located in the foreground, this side of the used car lot; a site now included in the roadway. On the extension of 6th Avenue, they were forced to vacate, as the new thoroughfare incorporated their holdings. Their new home was constructed one block to the north.

April 30, 1940
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr
